intro: Anemonospermos glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular anemonospermos, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Anemonaceae and is characterized by its showy, often yellow or white flowers. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, with small, glandular structures that may aid in water retention or chemical defense. Its blooming period typically occurs in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
